attributes.action: Requesting the immediate termination of the current government
attributes.additional_details: The Referendum was a chance for the country to decide the future of the UK, in this democratic vote there where mistruths told from both sides however the vote was Remain or Leave and Leave won, the country then went through a general election where both major parties committed to manifestos that said they would honor the decision of the referendum and leave the EU. Now we have a large number of MP's going against that commitment the Queen should dissolve parliament and force a General Election to allow the public to show how they feel
attributes.background: Both the Conservative and the Labour party committed to manifestos that said they would honour the referendum and now both parties have both gone against that commitment. This is a blatant breach of trust in the voting people of the UK

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it's very similar to petitions we already have open. 
 
You might like to sign and share one or more of these petitions. 

Have another general election  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/235480

Hold a General Election in April 2019.  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/235071

If Theresa May resigns as Prime Minister a general election must be held.  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/252449
